text: is a Japanese professional football clubJsoccer.com, "Japan J.League Teams" ; retrieved 2012-7-5. in Osaka.Soccerway.com, "Gamba Osaka"; retrieved 2012-3-2. ==History== The club was founded in 2001. *1980-1992 Matsushita Electric SC *1992-present Gamba Osaka ==League titles== *Japan Soccer League Division 2 : (1) **1985/86 *J1 League : (2) **2005, 2014 *J2 League : (1) **2013 *J.League Cup : (2) **2007, 2014 *Emperor's Cup : (4) **2008, 2009, 2014, 2015 *AFC Champions League : (1) **2008 ==League position== *2011 : J1 League - 3rd *2012 : J1 League - 17th *2013 : J2 League - 1st *2014 : J1 League - Champions *2015 : J1 League - 2nd *2016 : J1 League - 4th *2017 : J1 League - 10th *2018 : J1 League - 9th *2019 : J1 League - 7th *2020 : J1 League - 2nd ===Former positions=== == Notable achievements == The team has some notable achievements. In 2008, Gamba Osaka won the Emperor's Cup and the AFC Champions League, and won 3rd place at the FIFA Club World Cup. In 2010, Rafinha made three goals in one game for Gamba Osaka against Kawasaki Frontale.WorldFootball.net, "3 Goals in one game"; retrieved 2012-7-5. In 2014, Gamba Osaka won all three major titles in Japan, including the J1 League, the J. League Cup, and the Emperor's Cup. ==Related pages == * Sports in Japan * List of Japanese football teams * List of Gamba Osaka players == References == ==Other websites== * http://www.gamba-osaka.net/en/index.html ; * J.League Club Guide Category:Football clubs in Osaka
title: Gamba Osaka
